description: Oh-My-Zsh robbyrussell theme replica with iconic arrow prompt, Git status indicators, and directory path for seamless Claude Code shell integration.
author: JSONbored
content:
#!/usr/bin/env bash

# Oh-My-Zsh Robbyrussell Theme Replica for Claude Code
# Classic robbyrussell prompt: ➜  directory git:(branch) ✗

# Read JSON from stdin
read -r input

# Extract values
dir=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.workspace.path // "~"' | sed "s|$HOME|~|" | xargs basename)
model=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.model // "unknown"')

# Git status
git_branch=""
git_dirty=""
if git rev-parse --git-dir > /dev/null 2>&1; then
  git_branch=$(git rev-parse --abbrev-ref HEAD 2>/dev/null)
  # Check for uncommitted changes
  if ! git diff --quiet 2>/dev/null || ! git diff --cached --quiet 2>/dev/null; then
    git_dirty="✗"
  fi
fi

# Colors (robbyrussell classic palette)
CYAN="\033[38;5;51m"       # Cyan for arrow and directory
GREEN="\033[38;5;82m"      # Green for clean git
YELLOW="\033[38;5;226m"    # Yellow for dirty git
RED="\033[38;5;196m"       # Red for dirty indicator
RESET="\033[0m"

# Build prompt (robbyrussell style)
prompt="${CYAN}➜${RESET}  "
prompt+="${CYAN}${dir}${RESET} "

if [ -n "$git_branch" ]; then
  if [ -n "$git_dirty" ]; then
    prompt+="${YELLOW}git:(${git_branch})${RESET} ${RED}${git_dirty}${RESET} "
  else
    prompt+="${GREEN}git:(${git_branch})${RESET} "
  fi
fi

# Add model info (Claude Code specific)
prompt+="${CYAN}[${model}]${RESET}"

echo -e "$prompt"
features: Git branch display with parentheses format: git:(branch)
Dirty/clean Git status indicators (✗ for uncommitted changes)
Model name integration for Claude Code context
Zero dependencies beyond Git and jq
useCases: Oh-My-Zsh users wanting familiar prompt in Claude Code
Developers switching between shell and AI assistant frequently
Teams standardized on robbyrussell theme across tools
Visual continuity between terminal prompt and Claude statusline
Muscle memory from zsh prompt for instant context recognition

troubleshooting.issue: Arrow character (➜) showing as box or question mark
troubleshooting.solution: Ensure terminal uses UTF-8 encoding. Check: locale | grep UTF-8. Set if needed: export LANG=en_US.UTF-8. Verify font supports Unicode arrows (U+279C).

troubleshooting.issue: Git status always showing dirty (✗) even with clean repo
troubleshooting.solution: Check Git status manually: git status. Verify git diff commands work: git diff --quiet && echo clean. Ensure .gitignore not excluding modified files. Clear Git cache: git rm -r --cached . && git add .

troubleshooting.issue: Directory showing full path instead of basename only
troubleshooting.solution: Verify basename command available: which basename. Check sed command working: echo ~/foo/bar | sed 's|'$HOME'|~|' | xargs basename (should show 'bar'). Test jq extraction: jq -r .workspace.path.

troubleshooting.issue: Colors incorrect or showing different shades than Oh-My-Zsh
troubleshooting.solution: Oh-My-Zsh uses 256-color codes. Verify terminal: tput colors (should be 256). Compare: echo -e '\033[38;5;51mCyan\033[0m' with zsh prompt. Adjust color codes if terminal palette differs.

troubleshooting.issue: Git branch not detected despite being in repository
troubleshooting.solution: Check Git installed and in PATH: git --version. Verify in repo: git rev-parse --git-dir. Ensure script can execute git: which git. Test branch detection: git rev-parse --abbrev-ref HEAD

gapAnalysis.identifiedGap: No Oh-My-Zsh specific theme replicas exist. Starship is different aesthetic (Rust-based, modern). Git statusline lacks robbyrussell's iconic format (arrow, git:branch notation). Oh-My-Zsh has 170k+ stars and robbyrussell is the default theme most developers recognize. Users migrating from zsh want familiar prompt aesthetics for visual continuity.
